questions.question: Can you walk me through your typical UI design process?
questions.canonical_answer: I start with requirements and research, create wireframes, build high-fidelity designs, iterate based on feedback, and hand off assets to developers.

questions.question: How do you ensure your designs align with the overall brand identity and design system?
questions.canonical_answer: I follow brand guidelines, use consistent components, match color and typography rules, and maintain alignment with the design system.

questions.question: What are the key principles you follow to create visually balanced and intuitive interfaces?
questions.canonical_answer: I use alignment, spacing, contrast, hierarchy, and consistency to ensure clarity and ease of use.

questions.question: How do you decide on color palettes and typography for a new product?
questions.canonical_answer: I consider brand tone, target audience, accessibility, and visual harmony, testing combinations for readability and mood.

questions.question: Which design tools and technologies do you use most often, and why?
questions.canonical_answer: I use Figma, Sketch, and Adobe XD for collaboration, prototyping, and efficient design workflows.

questions.question: How do you collaborate with UX designers, developers, and product managers?
questions.canonical_answer: I communicate early, share design drafts, collect feedback, follow handoff processes, and ensure alignment on user and business goals.
